message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DM, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating the underlying graph associated with an Ising model given a number of independent and identically distributed samples. This problem is related to information theory (cs.IT), machine learning (cs.LG), discrete mathematics (cs.DM), social and information networks (cs.SI), and computational complexity (cs.CC). The paper uses Fano's inequality and ensembles of graphs to obtain lower bounds on the sample complexity, which are techniques commonly used in these sub-categories.
